articles.title: Trump sets 7,500 annual limit for refugees entering U.S. It’ll be mostly white South Africans.
articles.description: The move cements a major shift in policy toward refugees that aligns with the Republican administration’s broader goals of keeping out foreigners whom it deems a risk to the nation’s security or a threat to U.S. jobs.
articles.content: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration is restricting the number of refugees admitted annually to the United States to 7,500 and they will mostly be white South Africans, a dramatic drop announced Thursday that effectively suspends America’s tradition... [4459 chars]

articles.description: Organ donors in New York can now get their costs paid by the state, thanks to a first-in-the-nation program that could save dozens of lives a year. Last Thu
articles.content:
Organ donors in New York can now get their costs paid by the state, thanks to a first-in-the-nation program that could save dozens of lives a year.

articles.title: Grunkemeyer returns to his roots Saturday for PSU football
articles.description: Ethan Grunkemeyer grew up in Lewis Center, Ohio — about 30 minutes from the Horseshoe. Saturday, he’ll make his second career start with the Nittany Lions (3-4 overall, 0-4 in the Big Ten) against the nation’s top-ranked team, the 7-0 Buckeyes (noon, Fox). “Ever since I was a kid, I dreamed of playing in that […]

articles.title: DC to provide food assistance to its residents if SNAP benefits expire on Nov. 1
articles.description: The nation's capital will use it's contingency fund to support the roughly 140,000 residents who rely on SNAP benefits
articles.content: The nation's capital will use its contingency fund to support the roughly 140,000 residents who rely on SNAP and WIC benefits that are set to expire on November 1 amid a government shutdown that has already strained much of the DMV region and a court... [1453 chars]

articles.title: Trump Admin Recruits Federal Officers to Police DC
articles.description: President Donald Trump's administration launched a campaign on Thursday to recruit federal law enforcement officers to police the streets of the nation's capital.
articles.content:
President Donald Trump’s administration launched a campaign on Thursday to recruit federal law enforcement officers to police the streets of the nation’s capital, according to a new government website.

articles.title: Don’t fly above Red Lake! Tribe impounds plane that made emergency landing.
articles.description: A greater Minnesota pilot landed on a public road within the Red Lake Nation, and the tribe's confiscation of his aircraft raises questions about tribal sovereignty, the rights of nontribal members, and who owns the nation's airspace.
articles.content: With about 30 years of flying experience, off and on, he did what he said any pilot would do, he said: He landed on the paved road, which was clear of traffic. He flagged down a truck, and it turned out to be a neighbor from Roseau, who called police... [5439 chars]

articles.title: Influential Cuban Dissident Says His Fight Against Government Will Continue off the Island
articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — Influential Cuban dissident leader José Daniel Ferrer, recently exiled from Cuba, says that the island's fractured and weakened opposition movements need to shift strategies and oppose the government from outside the Caribbean nation.
articles.content:

articles.title: Utah to give $4 million to local food banks during government shutdown
articles.description: ‘Utah is known as the most charitable state in the nation. That’s the spirit that defines us,’ Utah Senate president said
articles.content:
As the federal government’s shutdown approaches a month, Utah state leaders have come up with a plan to make sure its citizens dependent on SNAP benefits will not go hungry.
